intro: Homalobus orthocarpus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is well adapted to drought conditions, with a deep root system that helps it survive in sandy soils. Homalobus orthocarpus is often found in desert scrub and creosote bush communities.
